column4: hello all, I have installed multiple video players (VLC, Mplayer, totem-xine, etc.) and the libdvdcss and the commercial DVD video I am trying to play breaks up and the picture appears to melt down upon trying to play it in all of theses, any suggestions?
do you know if the dvd is alright? not scratched etc?
it might be using some kind of weird windows only copying prevention too..
try running the media player in a terminal and see what kind of error messages you get
that would work
It attempts to plat it and then give me: VLC media player 0.8.6e Janus Segmentation fault after bit rate, etc.
oh.. try one of the other ones
OK
It give me the error: The source seems encrypted, and can't be read. Are you trying to play an encrypted DVD without libdvdcss?
well.. is libdvdcss installed?
yes
well, it seems ubuntu can't read the contents of the dvd for some reason..
hmmmm , let me try another DVD.
Its playing Spiderman 3! Must be the first DVD was corrupted! Sorry! Thanks for your help. Looks like I will have to buy a new copy of the Bourne Ultimatum! (maybe a CIA plot.) VLC the best.
I am a newie, what can I say?
no worries.. it happens
hope you can find a copy that works for you
Thanks again for your help.
By now I've got enough video players and Codecs installed to start my own movie studio...:-)
hehe
If you are still here, Geekbox played the DVD (Bourne Ultimatim)that I couldn't play on Ubuntu just fine...
